thread.title: UConn men, women debut Friday at First Night
thread.title_full: UConn men, women debut Friday at First Night

author: Day Staff Reports
title: UConn men, women debut Friday at First Night
text:
UConn men, women debut Friday at First Night Published October 15. 2015 9:13PM Day Staff Reports 
First Night, the annual tip-off party for the UConn men's and women's basketball teams, will have something for everyone. 
There's a Fan Fest on Fairfield Way outside Gampel Pavilion in Storrs on Friday at 3 p.m. 
An autograph session with both teams will run from 6-7 p.m. in the Athletic Director's lobby between the East and South entrances of Gampel. 
It's opportunity to check out the dance moves of your favorite player during introductions. 
This year's theme is "Glow-in-the-Dark." Get there early – doors open at 6 p.m. – because the first 8,000 fans will receive special glow-in-the-dark sunglasses. Fans are encouraged to join in the fun by wearing neon or anything else that will reflect the theme of the night. 
And there's the usual First Night festivities – three-point shooting and dunk contests, prize giveaways, light show, pep band performance and an inter-squad scrimmage. Men's coach Kevin Ollie and women's coach Geno Auriemma will attempt to lead their respective teams to victory. 
Ollie's team will feature Rodney Purvis, Morgan Tuck, Katie Lou Samuelson, Moriah Jefferson, Shonn Miller, Tierney Lawlor, Steve Enoch, Sterling Gibbs, Omar Calhoun, De'Janae Boykin, Nnamdi Amilo, Amida Brimah and Saniya Cong. 
Auriemma's roster includes Jalen Adams, Gabby Williams, Breanna Stewart, Terry Larrier, Daniel Hamilton, Phil Nolan, Briana Pulido, Christian Foxen, Kentan Facey, Kia Nurse, Sam Cassell Jr., Natalie Butler, Courtney Ekmark and Napheesa Collier.
